thag16.7:1.1_0: I rode on an elephant’s neck,
thag16.7:11.1_0: Living at the foot of a tree, persistent,
thag16.7:13.1_0: Living in a charnel ground, persistent,
thag16.7:14.1_0: Accepting whatever seat is offered, persistent,
thag16.7:15.1_0: Not lying down to sleep, persistent,
thag16.7:2.2_0: are happy with the scraps in their bowls.
thag16.7:2.3_0: practicing absorption, they meditate without grasping,
thag16.7:2.4_0: has plunged into the forest and practices absorption.
thag16.7:21.1_0: Giving up a valuable bronze bowl,
thag16.7:21.2_0: and colored by the king of Death,
thag16.7:22.1_0: I used to live in a citadel with walls so high,
thag16.7:22.4_0: and yet I trembled with fear.
thag16.7:23.1_0: Today I am fortunate, free of cowardice,
thag16.7:23.2_0: with fear and dread given up.
thag16.7:23.4_0: has plunged into the forest and practices absorption.
thag16.7:24.1_0: Established in the entire spectrum of ethics,
thag16.7:24.5_0: ... with Kāḷigodhā, a senior monk who is Kāḷigodhā,
